html: It was evident from the weekly export report that, as predicted, the Chinese-U.S. tariff situation was not affecting the supply demand situation for cotton. Regardless of “who does what” cotton supplies are very tight and mills will continue to buy U.S. cotton.
text:
It was evident from the weekly export report that, as
predicted, the Chinese-U.S. tariff situation was not affecting the supply
demand situation for cotton.  Regardless of “who does what” cotton supplies are very tight and mills will continue to
buy U.S. cotton.

html: US/Brazil #Soybean price spread at 5-yr high of more than $70/tonne ($1.90/bu). That would place US origin at ~17% discount to BRZ (vs. now 25% tariff by China). That said, all else equal, US values would need to drop another 90c to be at parity vs. 25% duty. #OATT, #USChinapic.twitter.com/NP2OolZrAo
text: US/Brazil #Soybean price spread at 5-yr high of more than $70/tonne ($1.90/bu). That would place US origin at ~17% discount to BRZ (vs. now 25% tariff by China).
